definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
watchtower on either side of a city gate/(literary) city/imperial palace
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
to go to the palace to see the emperor
Kul Tigin or Kultegin (685-c. 731), general of the Second Turkic Kaganate

sentences.english: Some records, make up the history books of the palace.
sentences.chinese: 有些記載，彌補了史書之闕。

sentences.english: Here I also copy Charley Que of NXP.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，我也複製查理恩智浦闕。

sentences.english: And so live ever-or else swoon to die.
sentences.chinese: 永遠這樣活着或昏闕而死去。

definition: (literary) to end/to stop/one of the stanzas (usually two) of a ci poem 詞|词[ci2]/classifier for songs or ci poems
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to go (to visit a superior)/one's current attainment in learning or art
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
(literary) (final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 呢[ne5] or 啊[a1])
